plugins.name: Find and Replace Screens
plugins.description:
Find and Replace Screens is a tool designed to streamline the process of updating screens in Figma with just one click. Whether you're transitioning from wireframes to final UI designs or updating screens across an entire flow, this plugin saves you time by keeping your layout, connectors, and arrows intact. No more manual re-positioning or reconnecting screens!


Key features:

  1. One-Click screen replacement: Update multiple instances of the same screen with a single action, ideal for projects where the same screen is used in multiple places.
  2. Preserves layout and flow: Replacing a screen won't disturb its surrounding elements, including arrows, connectors, and positions within the flow.
  3. Flexible use case: While perfect for wireframe-to-UI transitions, the plugin is also useful for updating iterations of any design screen without losing structure.


How to Use:

  1. Choose the new screen you want to use (UI design, updated iteration, etc.).
  2. Select the screen(s) you want to replace in the flow.
  3. Click "Replace Screen" to swap the content while maintaining connections and layout positions.


Limitations:

  1. For best results, ensure the new screens are similar in size to the ones being replaced, as large size differences may affect layout alignment.
  2. Does not adjust connectors/arrows if the new screen's size significantly differs from the original.
plugins.tagline: Find and Replace Screens across your project with one click while keeping connections intact.

This plugin is brought to you by HubSpot DevRel Labs, an initiative to create solutions for developers to thrive while building with HubSpot.

Create amazing HubSpot UI Extensions designs in minutes. Do you need to prototype a UI Extension quickly for your clients? Well, now you can with the HubSpot UI Extensions Figma plugin. Download the Figma Design Kit, install this plugin and choose from our library of UI components. Add multiple of the same components to a card, order them in any way you'd like, and watch the magic happen as the UI extension is built for you.

plugins.name: Big-Tech Style Design Challenges
plugins.description:
‚ú® Figma Plugin Description

Practice real-world design challenges directly inside Figma.

Sharpen your product thinking and UX skills with guided prompts and exercises ‚Äî perfect for designers prepping for interviews or just looking to stay sharp.


üåê What is Designus?

When you submit your solution via the plugin, your work gets published to the Designus platform ‚Äî where you can explore other designers' answers and learn from diverse approaches.

Use the plugin to focus on solving the challenge, and head to the website to review and reflect on submitted solutions.


üõ† How to Use the Plugin

  1. Launch the plugin
  2. Choose a challenge from the calendar
  3. Click Import to add the challenge & solution frame to your canvas
  4. Design your solution directly inside Figma
  5. Reopen the plugin and go to Export Solution
  6. Select your solution frame and write a short description
  7. Click Export to submit your answer
  8. Go to Designus website to review your submission and check out others' solutions.
plugins.tagline: Design Challenges - Level up your design skills through real design challenges.

plugins.name: CSS Variables to Figma
plugins.description:
Import css variables into Figma variables

This plugin enables you import color variables from CSS into Figma, supporting both single-mode and dual Light/Dark mode setups. It maps your CSS variables to Figma's variable modes, converting formats like OKLCH (Tailwind), HEX, RGBA, and RGB into Figma-compatible HEX values. OKLCH, P3, and HCT color values are also preserved and attached to each variable for reference.


Example:


.light {
--color-primary: #000;
}
.dark {
--color-primary: #fff;
}


How it works:

  1. Paste your CSS variables in the text area below.
  2. Click "Export to JSON" to generate a Figma-compatible variables file.
  3. Import the JSON file into Figma using the Figma Variables by Honza Toman


Watch video‚Üí how it works.


Currently supported:

  1. Color variables
  2. Attach oklch, p3 colors and HCT values to variable syntax


Next updates:

  1. Border radius variables
  2. Spacing variables
  3. Shadows
  4. ...


Feedback and support

  1. Let us know your feedback and suggestions! @sans_sherif
  2. Support the development of this plugin buy us a coffee ‚òï
plugins.tagline: Import existing css variables to figma variables

plugins.name: Variable Calculator
plugins.description:
Easily calculate variable values

Use Variable Calculator to apply math formulas, recalculating your variables. Apply to en entire collection, specific group, or specific mode. Great for scaling numbers for responsive behavior.


  1. Select your collection
  2. Select the target mode or all modes
  3. Enter the path to a group of variables
  4. Enter the formula to apply to the variables
  5. Calculate!


Tip

  1. Use a, b, c, n, v, x, $ or value to reference the current variable value.
  2. Keep your variable window open to see the changes.
  3. Use the Refresh button to pull in changes to the variables made when the plugin window is open. (see below for copy & paste)
  4. Use clear to quickly delete the path.


Plugin Notes

  1. Variable names and paths are case sensitive.
  2. Updating variables, especially those linked to text styles may take longer to propagate.


Copy/Paste Figma Bug

If you copy/paste variables between collections, you may need to reload the tab in order for those variables to register in their new collection.

accepted.name: Murph
accepted.description: Systems Designer ‚Ä¢ Plugin Author ‚Ä¢ Rectangle Lover

plugins.tagline: Run math operations on your variable values!

  2. Updating variables, especially those linked to text styles may take longer to propagate.


Copy/Paste Figma Bug

If you copy/paste variables between collections, you may need to reload the tab in order for those variables to register in their new collection.

plugins.name: Notion Book Cover Formatter
plugins.description:
Notion Book Cover Formatter solves the common problem of adapting vertical book covers (typically in 2:3 ratio) to Notion's responsive format. Instead of struggling with manual resizing and background creation, this plugin automatically:

  1. Positions your book cover perfectly within the Notion image dimensions
  2. Creates a beautiful and consistent background from the original cover


Step by step instructions:

  1. Upload a book cover image
  2. Plugin creates a frame containing the formatted image
  3. Export the frame
  4. Upload to Notion as "Files & Media"
plugins.tagline: Notion-ready book covers with a single image upload

plugins.name: Convert To Bionic Writing
plugins.description:
Unlock Faster, More Focused Reading with Bionic Reading: This plugin applies the Bionic Reading method (bionic-reading.com) to your text layers, dynamically bolding the initial letters of words to improve reading speed and comprehension. By leveraging the natural fixation points of the eye, Bionic Reading helps readers process text more efficiently with less cognitive effort. This plugin works best with fonts that offer multiple weight variations.


Key Features:


  1. Converts selected text layers to Bionic Reading format.
  2. Optimizes text for faster and more focused reading.
  3. Ideal for improving readability and engagement.



Open Source: github.com/mrayubmuhammad/Convert-To-Bionic-Writing-Figma-Plugin



Created by d3flow (www.d3flow.com) using Claude.ai.

Note: Requires fonts with multiple weight options for optimal performance.

plugins.name: TDS - Persian Component Configuration Mapping
plugins.description:
Persian Converter for Alt Names

Effortlessly create component mapping for bilingual designers text in components with Persian support!


What it does

This plugin automatically converts Component configurations following "Alt. name:" lines to Persian script while preserving your original content. Perfect for designers working with multilingual interfaces or Persian localization.


Key Features


Smart Conversion

Transliterates English letters ‚Üí Persian script using Persian-Standard keyboard mappings.

Converts digits ‚Üí Persian numerals (€∞€±€≤€≥)

Preserves non-Persian symbols/punctuation


Clean Workflow

  1. Purge Existing Persian - Removes all prior Persian characters/numbers from "Alt. name:" lines
  2. Convert - Transforms English characters to Persian equivalents
  3. Append - Adds converted text below original with proper spacing


Ideal For

Persian interface localization

Bilingual design systems

Teams collaborating across Latin/Persian script workflows

Maintaining clean alt-text alternatives in components

Design System Managers


Why Design System Managers will Love It:

No manual copy-pasting between lines

Prevents script mixing errors

Case-insensitive matching ("ALT. NAME:", "alt name :", etc.)

Multi-Format Support (Plain text nodes, Markdown-enabled descriptions)


-----


Coded with AI and ZERO coding knowledge :)
plugins.tagline: Maps component configuration from english keyboard to Standart persian keyboard

  2. „Éá„Ç∂„Ç§„É≥„ÅÆÊõ¥Êñ∞Ôºö Ë§áÊï∞„ÅÆ„Ç§„É≥„Çπ„Çø„É≥„Çπ„Çí„Åæ„Å®„ÇÅ„Å¶„É°„Ç§„É≥„Ç≥„É≥„Éù„Éº„Éç„É≥„Éà„Å´„É™„É≥„ÇØ„Åï„Åõ„Åü„ÅÑÂ†¥Âêà„ÄÇ
  3. ÂÖ±Âêå‰ΩúÊ•≠Ôºö „ÉÅ„Éº„É†„É°„É≥„Éê„Éº„Åå‰ΩúÊàê„Åó„Åü„Ç≥„É≥„Éù„Éº„Éç„É≥„Éà„ÇÑ„Ç§„É≥„Çπ„Çø„É≥„Çπ„Çí„ÄÅÂäπÁéáÁöÑ„Å´ÊääÊè°„Åó„Åü„ÅÑÂ†¥Âêà„ÄÇ


---


This Figma plugin, "Find Components," helps you efficiently identify main components and instances from multiple selected layers.


Key Features:

  1. Filter Main Components/Instances: Extract and select only the main components or instances from the selected layers.
  2. List Search Results: The extracted components are displayed as a list. Clicking on a layer name will zoom into that specific layer.
  3. Gather Components: When executed, selected main components are replaced with instances, and the main components are moved to a new page.
  4. Toggle Target Type: Choose whether to target main components or instances from a dropdown menu.
  5. Support for Nested Layers: Even components/instances deeply nested within grouped layers can be found and selected.
  6. Cancel Processing: You can cancel the process at any time, even if the operation is heavy.


This plugin is useful in the following scenarios:

  1. Organizing Design Systems: Efficiently find specific components or instances among a large number of them.
  2. Updating Designs: Batch-link multiple instances to their corresponding main components.
  3. Collaborative Work: Quickly identify components or instances created by team members.

This Figma plugin, "Find Components," helps you efficiently identify main components and instances from multiple selected layers.


Key Features:

  1. Filter Main Components/Instances: Extract and select only the main components or instances from the selected layers.
  2. List Search Results: The extracted components are displayed as a list. Clicking on a layer name will zoom into that specific layer.
  3. Gather Components: When executed, selected main components are replaced with instances, and the main components are moved to a new page.
  4. Toggle Target Type: Choose whether to target main components or instances from a dropdown menu.
  5. Support for Nested Layers: Even components/instances deeply nested within grouped layers can be found and selected.
  6. Cancel Processing: You can cancel the process at any time, even if the operation is heavy.


This plugin is useful in the following scenarios:

  1. Organizing Design Systems: Efficiently find specific components or instances among a large number of them.
  2. Updating Designs: Batch-link multiple instances to their corresponding main components.
  3. Collaborative Work: Quickly identify components or instances created by team members.

- Changed to collect main components on the same page
- Fixed an issue where layer order changed when replacing with an instance

plugins.name: Text Paster
plugins.description:
What it does

This plugin allows you to:

  1. Select text layers from a selection
  2. Copy text strings from multiple text layers
  3. Paste text strings into multiple text layers in batch
  4. Sort text strings


How to use it

Transfer texts between frame

  1. Select a frame that contain text layers
  2. Click Copy in the plugin
  3. Select another frame that contain text layers you want to transfer the texts to
  4. Click Paste in the plugin


Transfer text from Spreadsheet

  1. Copy text from a spreadsheet (Google Sheets, Excel, etc.) or any line-break-separated text.
  2. Paste it into the text box in plugin
  3. Select a frame that contain text layers you want to paste the texts to
  4. Click Paste in the plugin


Delete hidden layers

  1. Select a frame
  2. Click Select "Hidden layer" (from dropdown menu)
  3. Press Delete key to delete hidden layers


-------

Kudos to AI ‚Äî This plugin is the result of vibe coding with Cursor and GitHub Copilot. All the features were built just to scratch my own itches.
plugins.tagline: Trasfer text in batch with copy and paste

plugins.name: AI Real Data Generator
plugins.description:
Description

Testing with real-life data is crucial, but setting up prototypes manually is time-consuming. With AI Real Data Generator Figma plugin, simply provide AI with your instructions and an example‚Äîusing your Gemini API key, it will instantly generate and replace data in your design, making prototyping seamless and efficient.


How to Use:

  1. Add the AI Real Data Generator plugin in Figma.
  2. Enter your Gemini API key to enable data generation.
  3. Provide instructions on the type of real-life data you need.
  4. Provide an example or data template to guide AI generation.
  5. AI instantly generates and replaces data directly in your Figma design.


Key Features:


  1. Instant data generation: AI quickly fills in real-world data in seconds.
  2. Customizable: Provide specific instructions and examples to match your needs.
  3. Seamless integration: Data replaces existing placeholders in your design automatically.
  4. Efficiency boost: Save time on manual data entry during prototyping.
  5. Powered by Gemini API: Leverage advanced AI for precise data generation, enabled with the free gemini-2.0-flash modal
plugins.tagline: Instantly fill your Figma designs with real-world data using AI-powered precision
